titleStmt.title: Duncan Harding et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9769

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: The undersigned Petitioners citizens of Harrison County would most Respectfully, Represent to your Excellency that that two fines have been assessed against Mason D Ellis and Nimrod Ashcroft one of $10 -- and the other a fine of $25 -- ^Each^ in the Harrison circuit court, that from all your Petitions have been able to Learn we think the fines unreasonable that the fine of $10 -- and the costs in both Suits is an ample punishment for the offence they committed if any, that they are both poor men and civil well disposed men and your Petitioners would most Respectfully pray your Excellency to Remit the fine of $25 -- Each against them, we would further Represent to your Excellency that the remission of the above fines would meet the approbation of 4/5 of the people who have any Knowledge of the parties and circumstances and in duty bound will Every pray &c
To his Excellency the Governor of Kentucky

Duncan Harding
Patrick. Watson
James. G. Watson
John. P. Watson
E. M. Taylor
Z, M, Pee
Abram Clark
Wm Burns Jr
Wm, C, Clark
S, C, Clark
Chas Brand
W. M. Asbury
Joseph. Whitley
S B Curran
H. S Hickman

W. T Asbury

A M Camron
